WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
Hi,

Code lens is a [new feature in Visual Studio 2013](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn269218.aspx).

After working with this on a C# project, I have found it to be a tremendous productivity booster.

CodeLens provides information about references, unit tests, check-ins etc. I'm not sure how unit tests would be incorporated but simply being able to view the references to a class or method is in itself hugely useful.

Thanks.
WorkItem.Summary: Please enable CodeLens for TypeScript files

Comments.Message: Thanks for the suggestion, this and Peek are both things we're investigating, but definitely won't be supported in 1.0

Yes please! Code lens with references would be incredibly helpful.

And a pretty sweet differentiator. ;)
